name: Hikma Health Inc
mission: We partner with nonprofit organizations providing healthcare in underserved and refugee populations. We create customized data systems for these healthc...
theoryOfChange: Hikma Health utilizes an 'implementation science framework' to understand the real-world application of its system. Their 'Our Approach' section details how they empower individuals with health data, offer clinicians data-driven tools, and enable clinic managers to anticipate needs and plan logistics. The 'Health and Environmental Record System (HERS)' page presents a flowchart that visually explains how their integrated EHR system collects environmental data, combines it with health records to identify at-risk patients, and produces results for targeted care, public health planning, and policy decisions at individual, health system, and government levels. This flowchart serves as a logic model, illustrating the causal pathways from their system's activities to desired outcomes.

evaluationSources: Grand Prize, 22nd Annual New Ventures Competition (Harvard Business School)

zakatClaimEvidence: Hikma Health's donation page and 'About Us' sections do not explicitly mention accepting zakat donations or having dedicated zakat funds or campaigns. (Source: https://www.hikmahealth.com/donate)

all_citations.claim: Hikma Health maintains a 100.0% program expense ratio, 26.0 months of working capital, and a fundraising efficiency of $0.00 per $1 raised.

Donations to Hikma Health support its mission to provide data systems for underserved populations and are eligible for general charitable giving (sadaqah).

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: Hikma Health earns a moderate score of 66/100, reflecting exceptional financial efficiency and a focus on systemic change, balanced by its smaller operational scale and medium data confidence.

dimension_explanations.alignment: With a score of 35/50, the organization shows high alignment due to the global urgency of healthcare for displaced populations [1]. It is identified as a sadaqah-eligible opportunity for donors interested in technology-driven global health solutions [3].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization achieves a 31/50 impact score by focusing on systemic change through data infrastructure rather than direct service delivery [1]. While it maintains a 100.0% program expense ratio and 26.0 months of working capital, the lack of specific cost-per-beneficiary data results in a medium impact rating [1][2].

baseline_narrative.headline: Hikma Health Inc. empowers nonprofit healthcare providers in underserved regions through the development of customized, open-source data systems.

baseline_narrative.summary: Hikma Health Inc. partners with organizations serving refugee and underserved populations to implement specialized health data infrastructure [1]. The organization operates with a focus on technological innovation, managing programs such as the Health and Environmental Record System (HERS) and deployment initiatives across Latin America [1][2].

strengths_deep_dive: Hikma Health's financial model is highly efficient for its size. By maintaining a <cite id="2">100.0% program expense ratio</cite> and a fundraising cost of <cite id="3">$0.00 per $1 raised</cite>, the organization ensures that donor contributions are maximized for programmatic impact. The charity also holds a Silver Seal of Transparency from Candid, reflecting its commitment to public accountability, and operates with a <cite id="7">board of 6 members</cite>.
rich_narrative.summary: Hikma Health Inc. partners with organizations serving refugee and underserved populations to implement specialized health data infrastructure. In 2023, the organization reported <cite id="1">$70,494 in total revenue</cite>. The charity demonstrates exceptional financial efficiency, maintaining a <cite id="2">100.0% program expense ratio</cite>, ensuring all funds directly support its mission. Furthermore, it operates with a fundraising efficiency of <cite id="3">$0.00 per $1 raised</cite>. The organization focuses on technological innovation, managing programs such as the <cite id="4">Health and Environmental Record System (HERS)</cite> and deploying electronic health records in regions like <cite id="5">Nicaragua</cite>.
